activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12531
activity.text:
Hi @nihal467,
I’ve implemented logic so that when a questionnaire contains multiple questions (including an appointment structured question), users can submit the questionnaire without scheduling an appointment (also empty reason for visit )" In this case, the slot API is not called, which works as expected.

However, if the questionnaire contains only the appointment structured question, and the user tries to submit it with just the "reason for visit" (without selecting a slot), the submission fails because the slot API is still called (since there’s no other structured request to send). This is due to the backend expecting at least one request, and our handler only generating a request if a slot is selected.

Please advise on how you’d like to handle this scenario:
- Should we create a generic appointment endpoint for "reason for visit" only?
- Or should we require a slot selection if the appointment question is the only question in the questionnaire?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12531
activity.text:
Hey @Jacobjeevan, the reason questionnaire submission is failing is because If the user fills only the “Reason for Visit” and skips appointment scheduling, Then slot_id is null, And our appointment getRequests() returns an empty array,
Which causes the POST /batch_requests/ to fail with a 400 error.

Do we have (or can we add) a backend fallback that allows submission even if no appointment is scheduled? For example: Either by accepting empty requests gracefully as a no-op, Or by having a separate request that stores just the reason_for_visit without requiring slot_id.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12455
activity.text:
hey @Jacobjeevan  @rithviknishad I need some clarification regarding this issue.

I'm currently working on it, and as we know, the "Refresh" and "Generate Reports" buttons were removed from the Files tab in PR #12419. So, for this issue, we only need to focus on adjusting the tab options (Files, Discharge Summary, Drawings), search input, and other buttons to make sure they render well on small devices.

I checked the Discharge Summary tab in the main Care app and confirmed that the Generate Reports button is not clipped, so no changes are needed there.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/93c8044e-10a4-4c21-9762-53d4bbc594c1)

I’ve pushed a fix that adjusts the layout for small screen sizes, as shown in the attached screenshot:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e66e762d-8eab-44c3-b134-d91cea72b958)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12436
activity.text:
hey @Jacobjeevan @rithviknishad  i want to work on this issue 
Approach:
- This issue occurs because when you add another answer for a repeatable choice question, the new answer options do not have unique IDs. Without unique IDs, React cannot properly track and update the selected state for each repeated option, causing selection to break.
- Ensure that every answer option (and every repeated answer instance) has a unique id property.
- implement this by generating unique ID using crypto.randomUUID or similar methods to ensure Use this id as the React key and for tracking selection.

ETA : Tuesday

In your UI, when you set the answer to "yes", it is saved as a string, but the logic its expects a boolean (true/false)
what your thoughts ??

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12039
activity.text: hey @rithviknishad this issue was caused by className="truncate" in the DatePicker component, which was cutting off long date strings like "September 10th, 2026" when they overflowed the input width. my approach: I removed the truncate class from the in this code . Now it displays correctly without being clipped ETA : Today ``` {date ? ( <> {format(date, "MMM d, yyyy")} {format(date, "PPP")} ) : ( {t("pick_a_date")} )} ```

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11997
activity.text: Hey @areebahmeddd  I think we should consider using [tj-actions/changed-files](https://github.com/tj-actions/changed-files) to detect which files were changed in a PR or push. It’s really helpful for conditionally running jobs in our CI/CD pipeline—like only triggering tests or builds when relevant parts of the codebase change. Would be great for optimizing things like Cypress runs too.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11785
activity.text:
Hey @rithviknishad ,
You mean we should approach it like this, right?

- The structured_type field no longer defaults to "allergy_intolerance".

- Instead, a placeholder ("Select structured type") is shown until the user makes a selection.

- If the user doesn't select any value, an error message like "Structured type is required" is displayed.

Just wanted to confirm that this is the direction you're suggesting?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11785
activity.text: Fix: Ensure structured_type is set for structured questions

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11390
activity.text:
Hey @nihal467 , I just solved this issue! Now, the structured_type field is automatically set to "allergy_intolerance" and sent to the backend.

The issue occurred because the structured_type field wasn’t being sent when the default value ("allergy_intolerance") was selected but not explicitly changed. This was likely due to the field not being properly initialized or not getting included in the request payload when unchanged.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/791d2c2c-743a-4d14-a32d-668897c457b4)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11684
activity.text: hey @rithviknishad this issue isn't with ShadCN's sidebar itself but with how we're managing its state. Instead of relying solely on open, we should check isMobile to determine whether the sidebar should be open in mobile view.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11684
activity.text:
Hey @abhimanyurajeesh, I found the root cause of the issue it was due to the sidebar state (open) not updating automatically when the screen size changed. The component wasn’t responding to changes in isMobile, causing inconsistent behavior.

To fix this, we added a useEffect hook inside the SidebarProvider component to detect screen size changes and ensure the sidebar opens automatically on mobile. Can you check it?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11514
activity.text:
hey @nihal467  @rithviknishad I propose to fix the clipping issue of the patient record pop-up in mobile view by applying responsive design adjustments. Specifically:

Use position: fixed or absolute with appropriate z-index, top, and left settings.

Add media queries to adapt width and height for smaller screens (e.g., width: 90vw, max-height: 80vh, and scrollable content if needed).

Ensure the container is scrollable (overflow-y: auto) and doesn’t exceed viewport height.

This will ensure the modal/pop-up remains fully visible and user-friendly across devices.

Expected Timeline:
End date: 26 March 2025

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11335
activity.text:
@rithviknishad i want to work on this issue my approach 
Approach:
Check for Updates on Login:

Fetch the latest app version from the backend.
Compare it with the locally stored version.
If a new version is detected, show a banner with an "Update Now" button.
Seamless Update Process:

Clicking "Update Now" will reload the app with the latest version.
Use service workers or cache-busting strategies to ensure the latest assets load.
Sync Across Open Tabs:

Use the BroadcastChannel API to notify all tabs when an update is triggered in any tab.
All other tabs will reload automatically to apply the update.
Expected Timeline
End date: Saturday

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11099
activity.text:
Hey @nihal467 , 
I would like to work on this issue so , I propose replacing all instances of the React Date Picker with the device’s default date picker to enhance the UX, particularly on mobile devices. My approach will involve:

Identifying all occurrences of the React Date Picker across the platform.
Replacing it with the native <input type="date">, which triggers the default date picker on mobile devices.
Ensuring proper styling and compatibility across different browsers and devices.
Testing the implementation to confirm it improves the UX without breaking any existing functionality.

End date: EOD
